DataElement.preferredName: Fractionation Radiation Therapy Administered Per Fraction Plan Dose Unit of Measure Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The unit of measure that represents a determinate amount or quantity of the dose per fraction of prescribed radiation that was administered.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the administration of radiation therapy, treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation, divided into several smaller, equal doses delivered over a period of several days.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Dividing the total dose of radiation therapy into several smaller, equal doses delivered over a period of several days.:use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.

Concepts.definition: Radiation therapy in which the total dose delivered is divided into several smaller, equal doses delivered over a period of several days.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ValueDomain.preferredName: Per Fraction Plan Dose Unit of Measure Name
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: For each, generally denoting a ratio._A part, a fragment of a whole._To devise, contrive, or form in design._A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time._A named quantity in terms of which other quantities are measured or specified, used as a standard measurement of like kinds._The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The metric unit of absorbed radiation dose equal to the absorption of one hundredth of joule of radiation energy per kilogram of matter.

Concepts.definition: The metric unit of absorbed radiation dose equal to the absorption of one hundredth of joule of radiation energy per kilogram of matter.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The SI derived unit of absorbed radiation dose. One gray is equal to an absorbed dose of one joule per kilogram of matter; one gray equals 100 rads. The unit is named for the British physician L. Harold Gray, an authority on the use of radiation in the treatment of cancer.

Concepts.definition: A SI derived unit of absorbed radiation dose. One gray is equal to an absorbed dose of one joule per kilogram of matter, or to 100 rads.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Per Fractions Plan Dose Unit of Measure Name
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: For each, generally denoting a ratio.:Fraction; a small part or item forming a piece of a whole.:Planned; devised, contrived, or formed in design.:A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time. :A named quantity in terms of which other quantities are measured or specified, used as a standard measurement of like kinds.:The words or language units by which a thing is known.

Concepts.definition: For each, generally denoting a ratio.
A part, a fragment of a whole.
To devise, contrive, or form in design.
A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.
A named quantity in terms of which other quantities are measured or specified, used as a standard measurement of like kinds.
The words or language units by which a thing is known.
